items.summary:
As part of the now live Black Friday Week sale, the official CarlinKit Amazon storefront is offering its compact MiNi Ultra Wireless CarPlay & Android Auto Adapter for $37.99 shipped. Don’t forget to clip the on-page coupon to see the discounted price during checkout. This model typically goes for $56, with some occasional discounts dropping it down to the $45 mark. Head below for more details, along with deals on other wireless adapters.

items.title: Score MSI’s QD-OLED 280Hz QHD gaming monitor for $400 this Black Friday (All-time low, $250 off)
items.summary:
As part of its now live Black Friday deals, Newegg is offering MSI’s 27-inch QHD QD-OLED gaming monitor for $399.99 shipped. Don’t forget to enter promo code BFE2488 during checkout to see the discounted price. This is $250 off from its usual going rate of $650, marking the lowest price we have tracked for it to date. It dropped to $440 on Amazon during last week’s Black Friday Week sale, where it’s been sold out ever since. Best Buy has it for $439.99 shipped right now as well, although Newegg’s offer beats it to deliver an additional $40 discount. It’s among the lowest prices we have tracked for a QD-OLED gaming monitor this Black Friday, making this a great time to cash in. Head below for more details.

items.title: Trump seizes control of Republicans' 2026 election strategy with his presidency on the line
items.summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -President Donald Trump isn't on the ballot in next November's midterm elections, but he's plunging into them with his own presidency at stake. He's calling candidates, making early endorsements, shaping strategy and pushing economic messaging to try to keep Congress in Republican hands, according to nine Republicans involved in election strategy. Read full story

items.title: AI is too risky to insure, say people whose job is insuring risk
items.summary: Major insurers including AIG, Great American, and WR Berkley are asking U.S. regulators for permission to exclude AI-related liabilities from corporate policies. One underwriter describes the AI models’ outputs to the FT as "too much of a black box."
